div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1601 Nablus (anc. Neapolis), Samaria, (727) 1891 ? Burial: c. 125 B.C. (Noe) Contents: 400 AR Antiochus VII: 14+ tetradr.; 1+ didr. (Tyre) Demetrius II: 11+ tetradr.; 4 didr. (Tyre) Sidon: 3 octadr. (intrusion ?) Tyre: 1 tetradr.; 1 didr. Ptolemy II: 1 tetradr. (Tyre) Disposition: Hamburger Sale June 13, 1892, nos. 2105-14 Hamburger, ZfN 1892, p. 329, note 1 Kadman, INCJ, hoard 15
